meals.instruction:
1. Preheat oven to 450F degrees. Line a baking dish with
parchment paper.

2. Spray or brush both sides of each chicken breast with
olive oil, and sprinkle with salt, pepper, garlic powder, onion
powder, oregano and paprika.

3. Bake, uncovered, for 10 minutes, flip to the other side,
lightly spray/brush again and bake for 8-10 more minutes,
or until juices run clear when pierced with a fork.

4. Transfer the baked chicken breasts to a platter. Loosely
cover with foil and allow to rest 5 minutes before slicing and
serving. Enjoy!
meals.name:
Garlic Herb Baked Chicken

Breast

meals.instruction:

with thin layer of water.
2. Place salmon on steamer rack in saucepan.
3. Cook and cover until salmon is opaque (about 10
minutes). Transfer to plate and let cool.
4. Flake salmon into chunks.
5. To make dressing and salad
Mix all ingredients together in a separate bowl using

Assemble mixed greens salad (save some chives
separately) and toss with dressing.
Sprinkle with remaining chives.

meals.instruction:
Heat 1 tablespoon of ghee in a cast-iron skillet over
medium heat, and saut� the mushrooms until the
liquid they released has cooked off. Set aside the
cooked mushrooms to cool to room temperature.
Pulse the frozen bacon pieces in the food processor
to the consistency of ground meat. Just a few pushes
should do it!
In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, bacon,
and mushrooms, and season with salt and pepper.
Using your hands, gently combine the ingredients.
Be careful not to overwork the meat!
Divide the mixture into four portions (or more if
you�re making sliders), and use your hands to flatten
each into 3/4-inch-thick patties.
Melt the remaining tablespoon of ghee in a cast iron
skillet over medium heat, and fry up the patties in
the hot fat, turning once. They should take about 3
minutes per side, whereas sliders should only take
about 2 minutes per side. Of course, you are free to
cook �em as well-done as you wish.
Transfer the patties to a wire rack so that any excess
fat can drain off. Pile them with your favorite burger
toppings, wrap them in lettuce leaves or roasted
Portobello mushrooms, and chow down!
meals.name: Big-O Bacon Burgers

ingredients.name: Ghee (lard, or fat of choice, divided)

Bacon (frozen and cross-cut into small

pieces)

meals.instruction:
DIRECTIONS FOR MUESLI MIX:
In a medium bowl or a container with a tightly fitting lid,
add coconut flakes, macadamia nuts, chia seeds, pumpkin
seeds, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg and a pinch of salt, mix
well.
Store muesli ingredients in a container with a tightly fitting
lid for a day or two to let the flavors develop. This mixture
will keep for up to two months.
DIRECTIONS FOR EACH SERVING:
In a small bowl, combine coconut milk, alcohol free vanilla,
stevia and lemon juice.
Stir well, then add muesli and top with a dollop of plain
yogurt.
For a softer texture, prepare a bowl the night before. Put a
serving of muesli in a bowl and cover with the coconut milk
mixture.
Place in refrigerator overnight. In the morning, enjoy plain
or with a dollop of yogurt.
meals.name: Bircher Muesli Mix

ingredients.name:
Macadamia nuts, unsalted (you can use
hazelnuts, almonds, pecans or walnuts)

meals.instruction:
Melt the vegan butter in a large pan. Add onions,
ginger, turmeric, garam masala, salt, paprika, and
cayenne pepper. Sautee for 2-3 min until fragrant
and the onions are soft and translucent.
Add garlic and saute for 2 min.
Then add canned tomatoes, tomato paste, and
coconut cream. Mix thoroughly and reduce liquid
until thickened about 10-15 minutes.
Add lentils and chopped cilantro. Garnish with
almonds and some more cilantro.
Advanced Preparation
1 - 3 days prior [optional], Red lentils, raw 2/3 cup
Instructions:
Cook your lentils in vegetable broth according to
package instructions.
meals.name:
Indian Inspired Butter
Lentils (vegan keto)

meals.instruction:

boil over high heat.

burner. Cover and let sit for 10-12 minutes.

Optional:
Steam the tempeh.
The easiest way to do this is by wrapping it in a wet
paper towel and placing in a microwave safe bowl.
Microwave in 2 minute increments, for 4 to 6
minutes total, stopping and letting it sit for a minute
or so between increments.
1. Stir coconut aminos, garlic, and ginger together in a
small bowl.
2. Coat the bottom of a large skillet with 1 tablespoon of
avocado oil and place over medium heat.
3. Add tempeh cubes in a single layer. Cook about 10
minutes, flipping once or twice, until browned on multiple
sides. Remove from heat.
4. Sprinkle the stir-fried tempeh with sesame seeds.
Serve and enjoy!

the lettuce over.

meals.instruction:
1. Shred the brussels sprouts thinly using a mandoline, or a
knife.
2. To prepare the dressing: whisk together the olive oil,
lemon juice, thyme, chives, salt and hazelnuts.
3. Five minutes before serving, place the shredded sprouts
in a large mixing bowl and toss gently with the dressing.
4. Taste and adjust the seasoning, adding more lemon juice
if needed. Keep in mind the cheese will bring a salty
element to the salad.

5. Add the cheese and toss once or twice to distribute it
evenly throughout the salad.

meals.instruction:
1. Chop your zucchini and then add it to a large food
processor along with your tahini, lemon juice, olive oil,
garlic, cumin, salt and pepper.
2. Process your zucchini hummus for about 30 seconds - 1
minute, until you get desired consistency. Season to taste
by adding more salt, if needed.
3. Prep your collard wraps by placing them flat (rough side
up) on a cutting board and gently glide a sharp paring knife
across the length of the stem, shaving it down to the same
thickness as the rest of the leaf. Each wrap will require two
leaves for rolling.
4. Place two leaves head to foot, overlapping halfway. Apply
a good amount of hummus at the center where the two
leaves overlap. Add desired toppings (see notes). Fold in
sides and tightly roll like you would a burrito. Cut through
the centre just before eating. Enjoy!
meals.name:
Collard Wraps with
Zucchini Hummus

meals.instruction:
1. In the bowl of a food processor, add walnut pieces, garlic,
red pepper flakes and salt and process until mixture is
coarsely ground, set aside.
2. Heat chicken broth in a medium saucepan over medium
heat. Add walnut mixture, saffron, paprika, ground
coriander, ground fenugreek and bring to a simmer.
3. Reduce heat to medium low and continue to simmer
sauce for 5 minutes. Remove from heat, stir in raw apple
cider vinegar.
4. Serve sauce at room temperature over grilled chicken.
Refrigerate remaining sauce in a covered container.

Chicken

meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 300 degrees F and set aside a
medium-large sized baking dish. Heat a large skillet
on your stovetop over medium heat. Prep your
vegetables according to ingredient instructions.
Mix the yogurt, hemp seeds, garlic, and a pinch of
salt and pepper in a small bowl. Set aside.
Add the oil to the skillet and let it heat up for a few
seconds. Once warmed, add the leek and scallion to
the skillet and reduce the heat to low. Cook until
soft, about 10 minutes. Once soft, add the spinach
and lemon juice; season with salt. Increase heat to
medium-high; cook, turning frequently until wilted,
4�5 minutes.
Transfer spinach mixture to your baking dish, leaving
any excess liquid behind. Make 4 deep indentations
in centre of the spinach mix in the baking dish.
Carefully break 1 egg into each indentation, taking
care to keep yolks intact.
Place your baking dish in the hot oven and bake
until your egg whites are set, about 10�15 minutes.
Meanwhile, warm a saucepan (or the skillet you
used for the vegetables) on your stovetop and
melt 2 tablespoon of butter over medium-low heat.
Add the chili powder and a pinch of salt and cook
until butter starts to foam and browned bits form at
bottom of pan, 1�2 minutes. Add oregano and cook
for 30 seconds longer.
Remove your eggs from the oven once they are
cooked and serve by divide the yogurt mixture over
the 2 portions of the spinach and eggs and then
drizzling with the spiced butter. Serve immediately.
meals.name: Keto Baked Eggs with Spinach & Garlic Yogurt

ingredients.name:
Chili powder (or crushed red pepper
flakes + a pinch of paprika)

meals.instruction:
1. Crack the eggs into a mixing bowl, season with a pinch of
sea salt and black pepper, then beat well with a fork until
fully combined.
2. Place a small non-stick frying pan on a low heat to warm
up.
3. Grate the cheese onto a board and set aside.
4. Add 1/2 tablespoon of oil to the hot pan, then carefully
pour in the eggs.
5. Tilt the pan to spread them out evenly, using a fork to
swirl the eggs around the pan a little.
6. When the omelette begins to cook and firm up, but still
has a little raw egg on top, sprinkle over the cheese.
7. Using a spatula, ease around the edges of the omelette,
then fold it over in half.
8. When it starts to turn golden brown underneath, remove
the pan from the heat and slide the omelette onto a plate. .
Enjoy!

meals.instruction:
Pour the chicken stock (or vegetable stock) in a large pot
and heat over a medium heat, until it starts to simmer.
Place the turmeric, ginger, garlic, mushrooms, chard stalks
and coconut aminos into the pot and simmer for about 5
minutes.
Then add the sliced chard leaves and cook for another
minute. In a bowl, whisk the eggs and slowly pour them into
the simmering soup.
Keep stirring until the egg is cooked and take off the heat.
Chop the cilantro and slice the spring onions. Add them to
the pot.
Pour into a serving bowl and drizzle with extra virgin olive
oil (a tablespoon per serving). Eat immediately or...
Let it cool down and store in an airtight container for up to
5 days
or...
Let it cool down in glass wide mouth mason jars and put it
in the freezer for another day. Make sure you do NOT fill the
jar higher than recommended, there is a line, or the glass
could break in the freezer.

3. Prepare the eggs whatever way you like them best

4. Place the prepared eggs on top of spinach mixture. Dig

greens)

Basil pesto (Sunflower Kitchen makes

amazing pestos!)

Goat cheese, semi-soft (can use 1/2 an
avocado for dairy free version)

meals.instruction: Enjoy as a snack in between meals.
meals.name: Toasted Almonds

meals.instruction:
DIRECTIONS FOR MUESLI MIX:
In a medium bowl or a container with a tightly fitting lid,
add coconut flakes, macadamia nuts, chia seeds, pumpkin
seeds, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg and a pinch of salt, mix
well.
Store muesli ingredients in a container with a tightly fitting
lid for a day or two to let the flavors develop. This mixture
will keep for up to two months.
DIRECTIONS FOR EACH SERVING:
In a small bowl, combine coconut milk, alcohol free vanilla,
stevia and lemon juice.
Stir well, then add muesli and top with a dollop of plain
yogurt.
For a softer texture, prepare a bowl the night before. Put a
serving of muesli in a bowl and cover with the coconut milk
mixture.
Place in refrigerator overnight. In the morning, enjoy plain
or with a dollop of yogurt.
meals.name: Bircher Muesli

ingredients.name:
Macadamia nuts, unsalted (you can use
hazelnuts, almonds, pecans or walnuts)

meals.instruction:
Add Ghee to a pan on medium heat and saut� the
shredded cauliflower.
Add the spinach leaves and cauliflower rice as the
base of the bowl.
Begin to arrange the chopped veggies and poached
eggs on top. (See notes on how to poach an egg)
Cook bacon in a pan on medium-high heat to desired
crispiness, remove from pan and place in a plate
with kitchen paper to soak up some of the fat, then
cut into bite size pieces and sprinkle on top of
veggies and eggs.
Serve and enjoy!
Garnish options: fresh herbs, chopped chili, fresh
lemon, salt and pepper to sprinkle on top, a drizzle
of Brain Octane Oil on top.
meals.name:
Bulletproof Veggie Buddha
Bowl

meals.instruction:
1. Combine almonds, sunflower seeds, flax meal and berries
in a bowl and pour coconut milk over them.

2. Top with cinnamon and serve in a beautiful bowl that
makes you feel like the awesome being you are!
meals.name:
Beautifying Breakfast
Cereal

meals.instruction:
Toss noodles and vegetables in peanut sauce.
Sprinkle with sesame seeds, cilantro, chopped peanuts, and a wedge of lime.
Can be served hot or cold - enjoy!
Advanced Preparation
1 - 3 days prior [optional], Japanese noodles, soba, dry 29 gm
Instructions:
Cook noodles according to package instructions. Store in an airtight container in the fridge.
1 - 5 days prior [optional], Peanut butter, natural 1/2 cup
Instructions:
Combine all peanut sauce ingredients in a blender. Blend until smooth. Season with salt and pepper.
meals.name:
Soba Noodle Salad with
Spicy Peanut Sauce (keto)

ingredients.name:
Green onion, scallion, ramp (thinly
sliced on a diagonal, garnish)

Cayenne pepper (to taste, for peanut

sauce)

Stevia, liquid (to taste, for peanut

sauce)

meals.instruction:
1. Preheat oven to 400F. Line a baking sheet with
parchment paper or foil.
2. Cook the onions in the vegetable oil in a pan over
medium heat for about 5 minutes until softened. Turn off
the heat, remove the pan from the heat, and allow the
onions to cool.
3. In a large bowl, mix the ground beef, cooked onions,
rosemary, sage, coriander, salt, and black pepper together
until thoroughly combined.
4. Form 2 inch balls from the mixture with your hands.
Arrange the balls on the baking sheet spaced evenly apart.
5. Bake for about 20 minutes in the oven or until the
meatballs are thoroughly cooked.
meals.name: Easy Baked Meatballs

meals.instruction: Enjoy as a snack in between meals.
meals.name: Toasted Almonds

meals.instruction:
Add all ingredients to a high-powered blender and
blitz until evenly combined, smooth and creamy.
Depending on how thick you like your smoothie you
can add in extra water and re-blend it until you
reach your desired consistency.
Taste and adjust the flavors if needed.
Pour into glasses and top with your chosen toppings.
See "Notes' below.
Notes:
Optional toppings
Chopped Bulletproof Chocolate Fuel Bar
Fresh organic raspberries or blueberries
Nut or seed butter
Shredded coconut
1-inch fresh grated ginger root
meals.name:
Keto Green Lemon
Smoothie

meals.instruction:
Heat 1 tablespoon of ghee in a cast-iron skillet over
medium heat, and saut� the mushrooms until the
liquid they released has cooked off. Set aside the
cooked mushrooms to cool to room temperature.
Pulse the frozen bacon pieces in the food processor
to the consistency of ground meat. Just a few pushes
should do it!
In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, bacon,
and mushrooms, and season with salt and pepper.
Using your hands, gently combine the ingredients.
Be careful not to overwork the meat!
Divide the mixture into four portions (or more if
you�re making sliders), and use your hands to flatten
each into 3/4-inch-thick patties.
Melt the remaining tablespoon of ghee in a cast iron
skillet over medium heat, and fry up the patties in
the hot fat, turning once. They should take about 3
minutes per side, whereas sliders should only take
about 2 minutes per side. Of course, you are free to
cook �em as well-done as you wish.
Transfer the patties to a wire rack so that any excess
fat can drain off. Pile them with your favorite burger
toppings, wrap them in lettuce leaves or roasted
Portobello mushrooms, and chow down!
meals.name: Big-O Bacon Burgers

ingredients.name: Ghee (lard, or fat of choice, divided)

Bacon (frozen and cross-cut into small

pieces)

meals.instruction:
1. In the bowl of a food processor, add walnut pieces, garlic,
red pepper flakes and salt and process until mixture is
coarsely ground, set aside.
2. Heat chicken broth in a medium saucepan over medium
heat. Add walnut mixture, saffron, paprika, ground
coriander, ground fenugreek and bring to a simmer.
3. Reduce heat to medium low and continue to simmer
sauce for 5 minutes. Remove from heat, stir in raw apple
cider vinegar.
4. Serve sauce at room temperature over grilled chicken.
Refrigerate remaining sauce in a covered container.
meals.name:
Walnut Sauce Over Grilled
Chicken

1. Purchase organic almonds - enjoy 8-10 almonds a day as

meals.instruction: Mix everything up and enjoy as an easy and tasty side.
meals.name: Fennel and Arugula Salad

meals.instruction:
1. Chop your zucchini and then add it to a large food
processor along with your tahini, lemon juice, olive oil,
garlic, cumin, salt and pepper.
2. Process your zucchini hummus for about 30 seconds - 1
minute, until you get desired consistency. Season to taste
by adding more salt, if needed.
3. Prep your collard wraps by placing them flat (rough side
up) on a cutting board and gently glide a sharp paring knife
across the length of the stem, shaving it down to the same
thickness as the rest of the leaf. Each wrap will require two
leaves for rolling.
4. Place two leaves head to foot, overlapping halfway. Apply
a good amount of hummus at the center where the two
leaves overlap. Add desired toppings (see notes). Fold in
sides and tightly roll like you would a burrito. Cut through
the centre just before eating. Enjoy!
meals.name:
Collard Wraps with
Zucchini Hummus

meals.instruction:
1. Leave zucchini skin on and shred zucchini, then add to a
kitchen towel and squeeze out any excess water

2. Toss minced chicken with zucchini, green onion, cilantro,
garlic, salt, and pepper and cumin. Mixture will be quite
wet.
3. Heat oil in a medium pan over medium heat.

4. Use a small scoop or a heaped tablespoon to scoop
meatballs into the pan.

5. Cook 8-10 at a time for about 5-6 minutes on the first
side. Flip and cook an additional 4-5 minutes, or until
golden brown and the centers are cooked through.
meals.name: Chicken Zucchini Meat Balls

ingredients.name:
Zucchini (leave peel on and squeeze
grated zucchini in a kitchen towel to
remove excess moisture)

Green onion, scallion, ramp (sliced or
1/2 medium white onion)

meals.instruction:
1. Crack the eggs into a mixing bowl, season with a pinch of
sea salt and black pepper, then beat well with a fork until
fully combined.
2. Place a small non-stick frying pan on a low heat to warm
up.
3. Grate the cheese onto a board and set aside.
4. Add 1/2 tablespoon of oil to the hot pan, then carefully
pour in the eggs.
5. Tilt the pan to spread them out evenly, using a fork to
swirl the eggs around the pan a little.
6. When the omelette begins to cook and firm up, but still
has a little raw egg on top, sprinkle over the cheese.
7. Using a spatula, ease around the edges of the omelette,
then fold it over in half.
8. When it starts to turn golden brown underneath, remove
the pan from the heat and slide the omelette onto a plate. .
Enjoy!
meals.name: Simple Cheese Omelette

meals.instruction:
1. In a small bowl, whisk together eggs, nutritional yeast,
almond milk, cayenne pepper, and salt. Stir in scallion.
2. Heat a skillet over medium heat and add coconut oil. Add
egg mixture and wait for skillet to return to medium heat.
When a thin cooked layer of egg is apparent at the bottom,
gently move the egg mixture around. Continue to gently
move the egg as it is cooked, exposing more raw egg to the
heat of the pan. This will create large fluffy pillow of egg
rather than small crumbly bits.
3. Serve with avocado. Garnish with sea salt and pepper.
Serve immediately.
meals.name: Easy-Peasy Scrambled Eggs and Veggies

meals.instruction:
Mix the tuna, bell pepper, celery, mayonnaise,
pickle, capers, and a sprinkle of their brine, mustard,
dill, and black pepper in a bowl.
Arrange the romaine leaves on plates. Spoon the
salad into the leaves, leaving enough room to fold
the lettuce over.
meals.name: TNT Tuna Salad

ingredients.name:
Tuna, albacore, flaked, canned in water
(or skipjack tuna; 6 oz cans)

Red bell pepper (chopped into small
pieces)

Capers, canned (plus a sprinkling of the
brine they�re packed in)

Lettuce, romaine (or belgian endive or
radicchio for a different taste)

meals.instruction:
Put the coconut oil and nut butter in a small pot over
medium heat. Allow them to melt together, stirring
occasionally.
Add in the cocoa, salt and sweetener and stir.
Pour the mixture into a mini cupcake pan. It's
easiest to line the pan with mini cupcake liners, but
if you don't have them it's ok. You could also use a
large cupcake pan and make the fat bombs a little
bigger as well.
Place in the freezer for about 20 minutes, or until
the mixture is solid in the pan. Remove and eat!
They will melt quickly so you'll want to eat them
fast.
meals.name:
Vegan Salted Chocolate
Freeze Fudge 2 ways!

meals.instruction:
Preheat oven to 300 degrees F and set aside a
medium-large sized baking dish. Heat a large skillet
on your stovetop over medium heat. Prep your
vegetables according to ingredient instructions.
Mix the yogurt, hemp seeds, garlic, and a pinch of
salt and pepper in a small bowl. Set aside.
Add the oil to the skillet and let it heat up for a few
seconds. Once warmed, add the leek and scallion to
the skillet and reduce the heat to low. Cook until
soft, about 10 minutes. Once soft, add the spinach
and lemon juice; season with salt. Increase heat to
medium-high; cook, turning frequently until wilted,
4�5 minutes.
Transfer spinach mixture to your baking dish, leaving
any excess liquid behind. Make 4 deep indentations
in centre of the spinach mix in the baking dish.
Carefully break 1 egg into each indentation, taking
care to keep yolks intact.
Place your baking dish in the hot oven and bake
until your egg whites are set, about 10�15 minutes.
Meanwhile, warm a saucepan (or the skillet you
used for the vegetables) on your stovetop and
melt 2 tablespoon of butter over medium-low heat.
Add the chili powder and a pinch of salt and cook
until butter starts to foam and browned bits form at
bottom of pan, 1�2 minutes. Add oregano and cook
for 30 seconds longer.
Remove your eggs from the oven once they are
cooked and serve by divide the yogurt mixture over
the 2 portions of the spinach and eggs and then
drizzling with the spiced butter. Serve immediately.
meals.name: Keto Baked Eggs with Spinach & Garlic Yogurt

ingredients.name:
Chili powder (or crushed red pepper
flakes + a pinch of paprika)

meals.instruction:
1. Combine all ingredients in a bowl, apart from chia seeds,
and mix well.
2. Add chia seeds slowly, mixing well so they don't clump.
3. Divide portions between jars and refrigerate.
meals.name:
Chocolate Chia Pudding
( RP )

ingredients.name:
Water, filtered (Add as needed only if

mixture is too thick)

meals.instruction:
Optional:
Steam the tempeh.
The easiest way to do this is by wrapping it in a wet
paper towel and placing in a microwave safe bowl.
Microwave in 2 minute increments, for 4 to 6
minutes total, stopping and letting it sit for a minute
or so between increments.
1. Stir coconut aminos, garlic, and ginger together in a
small bowl.
2. Coat the bottom of a large skillet with 1 tablespoon of
avocado oil and place over medium heat.
3. Add tempeh cubes in a single layer. Cook about 10
minutes, flipping once or twice, until browned on multiple
sides. Remove from heat.
4. Sprinkle the stir-fried tempeh with sesame seeds.
Serve and enjoy!
meals.name: Tempeh Stir-Fry ( Keto )

meals.instruction:
Line a 9x9-inch or 7x11-in pan with parchment or
wax paper.
In a medium microwave-safe bowl, heat the peanut
butter and honey on high for 30 seconds. Stir. Place
bowl back in the microwave and heat for another 30
seconds. Stir again. Mix in the oats and protein
powder until combined. Immediately spread evenly
into the prepared pan.
Refrigerate, uncovered, for 1 hour. Remove from the
fridge and cut into 12 bars. Cover and store on the
counter at room temperature for up to 1 week. (I just
store mine in the same pan with a lid.)
meals.name:
Easy Peanut Butter Protein
Bars

ingredients.name:
Whey protein powder, isolate, vanilla
(or any other protein powder)

meals.instruction:
1. Shred the brussels sprouts thinly using a mandoline, or a
knife.
2. To prepare the dressing: whisk together the olive oil,
lemon juice, thyme, chives, salt and hazelnuts.
3. Five minutes before serving, place the shredded sprouts
in a large mixing bowl and toss gently with the dressing.
4. Taste and adjust the seasoning, adding more lemon juice
if needed. Keep in mind the cheese will bring a salty
element to the salad.

5. Add the cheese and toss once or twice to distribute it
evenly throughout the salad.
meals.name:
Brussels Sprout Salad with

Hazelnuts

meals.instruction:
Pancakes
1. In a small bowl, sift coconut flour, baking soda and salt,
set aside.
2. In a medium bowl, whisk the eggs, and add milk, sliced
green onions and mashed avocado until thoroughly
combined.
3. Add dry ingredients and stir until combined.
4. Heat a skillet over medium heat. Melt enough coconut oil
to coat the bottom of pan.
5. For each pancake, spoon about 1/4 cup batter into pan
and cook until bubbles begin to appear on the top and
bottom is golden brown, about 2 to 3 minutes.
6. Flip pancake and cook until second side is golden brown,
about 2 to 3 minutes. Continue with remaining batter,
adding more butter to skillet as needed.
Lemon Parsley Sauce.
1. Melt the coconut oil and stir in lemon juice and parsley.
Keep warm until ready to serve.
Serve pancakes with sliced avocado, spring greens, lemon
slices and a drizzle of Lemon Coconut Parsley Sauce.
Garnish with thinly sliced green onions and minced parsley.
meals.name:
Avocado Pancakes with
Lemon Coconut Parsley
Sauce

meals.instruction:
1. Process the parsley, mint, garlic and sea salt in a food
processor until minced.

2. Transfer the herbs and salt to a large mixing bowl.

3. Add the tomatoes, hemp seeds, olive oil and lemon juice.
Mix well and serve.
meals.name: Hemp Seed Tabouli

meals.instruction:
First, lightly steam your finely chopped cauliflower in
a steamer for five minutes. Let the cauliflower cool
while you prep the other ingredients.
Combine the radicchio, artichoke hearts, basil,
parmesan, sundried tomatoes, olives, and garlic in a
medium bowl.
In a smaller bowl, whisk together the olive oil and
vinegar, then pour it over the salad. Toss to
combine, and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Can be served room temperature or chilled.
If you cannot find artichoke hearts you can use raw
asparagus instead chopped into small bits. Both raw
artichoke hearts and raw asparagus are a great source of
resistant starch which is fabulous food for your gut bugs
and essentially indigestible by us - hence it cannot and does
not get converted to sugar.
meals.name:
Antipasto Cauliflower
Salad ( Keto )

meals.instruction:
1. Purchase organic almonds - enjoy 8-10 almonds a day as
a power snack!
meals.name: A Handful of Almonds

meals.instruction:
1. Cook quinoa according to package directions.
2. Meanwhile, slice strawberries and cherries and place in a
large bowl along with blueberries
3. Mix the dressing ingredients (maple syrup, balsamic, lime
juice, salt) in a small jar and adjust to taste if necessary.
Note: You may have to double the dressing recipe if your
salad is quite large.
4. Fluff cooked quinoa with a fork and add to large bowl
with fruit. Combine. Pour on dressing and mix well.

5. Serve immediately or chill in the fridge until serving time.
meals.name: High Protein Fruit Salad

ingredients.name:
Maple syrup, pure (or other liquid

sweetener)

meals.instruction: Combine ingredients in a blender until smooth and enjoy!
meals.name: Chocolate Avocado Smoothie

meals.instruction:
1. Wash and dry spinach then chop into pieces
2. Add eggs to a pot and cover with cold water by 1 inch.
Bring water and eggs to a rolling boil at medium/high heat
for about 8-10 minutes. Remove eggs from heat, drain and
cool in ice water and peel
3. Crumble cheese with hands, cut cherry tomatoes in half
or leave full if they are bite size
4. Cook turkey bacon by placing strips on a skillet and turn
every 2-3 minutes, adjusting heat if necessary for about
8-10 minutes until bacon reaches your desired crisp.
Transfer strips using tongs to a paper-towel lined plate to
absorb some of the excess oil. Cut bacon into bite size
pieces for salad
5. Combine salad ingredients in a large bowl.
6. separate 1 large egg yolk in a separate large bowl, whisk
7. Blend egg yolk, mustard, salt, lemon juice, pepper in a
food processor or blender until smooth. Slowly add oil until
emulsified.
8. Add all salad ingredients together, drizzle with dressing.
Serve and enjoy!
meals.name: Clean Eating Cobb Salad

meals.instruction:
1. Mix the shredded cheese and almond flour/meal in a
microwaveable bowl. Add the cream cheese. Microwave on
HIGH for 1 minute.Stir then microwave on HIGH for another
30 seconds.
2. Add the egg, salt, rosemary and any other flavourings,
mix gently.
3. Place in between 2 pieces of baking parchment/paper
and roll into a circular pizza shape. Remove the top baking
paper/parchment. If the mixture hardens and becomes
difficult to work with, pop it back in the microwave for 10-20
seconds to soften again but not too long or you will cook
the egg.
4. Make fork holes all over the pizza base to ensure it cooks
evenly.
5. Slide the baking paper/parchment with the pizza base, on
a baking tray or pizza stone, and bake at 220�C/425�F for
12-15 minutes, or until brown.
6. To make the base really crispy and sturdy, flip the pizza
over (onto baking paper/parchment) once the top has
browned.
7. Once cooked, remove from the oven and add all the
toppings you like. Make sure any meat is already cooked as
this time it goes back into the oven just to heat up the
toppings and melt the cheese. Bake again at 220�C/425�F
for 5 minutes.
8. Topping Ideas: pepperoni, peppers, cherry tomatoes,
olives, ground/mince beef, mushrooms, herbs to customize
your pizza.
meals.name: Fat Head Pizza

meals.instruction:
1. Preheat oven to 400F. Line a baking sheet with
parchment paper or foil.
2. Cook the onions in the vegetable oil in a pan over
medium heat for about 5 minutes until softened. Turn off
the heat, remove the pan from the heat, and allow the
onions to cool.

meals.name: Easy Baked Meatballs

meals.instruction:
1. Wash and cut celery into 2 or 3-inch pieces.
2. Season cottage cheese with salt and pepper to taste.
3. If you like, add some dried or fresh herbs, like basil, dill,

knife.
2. To prepare the dressing: whisk together the olive oil,
lemon juice, thyme, chives, salt and hazelnuts.
3. Five minutes before serving, place the shredded sprouts
in a large mixing bowl and toss gently with the dressing.
4. Taste and adjust the seasoning, adding more lemon juice
if needed. Keep in mind the cheese will bring a salty
element to the salad.

5. Add the cheese and toss once or twice to distribute it
evenly throughout the salad.

meals.instruction:
1. Preheat oven to 450F degrees. Line a baking dish with
parchment paper.

2. Spray or brush both sides of each chicken breast with
olive oil, and sprinkle with salt, pepper, garlic powder, onion
powder, oregano and paprika.

3. Bake, uncovered, for 10 minutes, flip to the other side,

cover with foil and allow to rest 5 minutes before slicing and
serving. Enjoy!

meals.instruction:
DIRECTIONS FOR MUESLI MIX:
In a medium bowl or a container with a tightly fitting lid,
add coconut flakes, macadamia nuts, chia seeds, pumpkin
seeds, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg and a pinch of salt, mix
well.
Store muesli ingredients in a container with a tightly fitting
lid for a day or two to let the flavors develop. This mixture
will keep for up to two months.
DIRECTIONS FOR EACH SERVING:
In a small bowl, combine coconut milk, alcohol free vanilla,
stevia and lemon juice.
Stir well, then add muesli and top with a dollop of plain
yogurt.
For a softer texture, prepare a bowl the night before. Put a
serving of muesli in a bowl and cover with the coconut milk
mixture.
Place in refrigerator overnight. In the morning, enjoy plain
or with a dollop of yogurt.
meals.name: Bircher Muesli Mix

ingredients.name:
Macadamia nuts, unsalted (you can use
hazelnuts, almonds, pecans or walnuts)

meals.instruction:
1. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, whey protein, chia
seeds, hemp seeds and flax. Stir until combined.
2. In the same bowl, add in the almond butter, honey,
applesauce, coconut oil and vanilla. Mix until combined.
3. Mixture will be on the wet side. Pour mixture in a 8x8 pan
and allow to set in the fridge until completely cooled.
Mixture will harden up once it gets cold.
4. Remove from fridge, cut into 16 squares. Can be stored in
the fridge for just over a week, or place in the freezer and
they will last for a few months at least. They taste great
directly from the freezer.
meals.name:
No-Bake Hemp and Chia

Protein Bars

meals.instruction:
Line a 9x9-inch or 7x11-in pan with parchment or
wax paper.
In a medium microwave-safe bowl, heat the peanut
butter and honey on high for 30 seconds. Stir. Place
bowl back in the microwave and heat for another 30
seconds. Stir again. Mix in the oats and protein
powder until combined. Immediately spread evenly
into the prepared pan.
Refrigerate, uncovered, for 1 hour. Remove from the
fridge and cut into 12 bars. Cover and store on the
counter at room temperature for up to 1 week. (I just
store mine in the same pan with a lid.)
meals.name:
Easy Peanut Butter Protein
Bars

ingredients.name:
Whey protein powder, isolate, vanilla
(or any other protein powder)

meals.instruction:
1. Mix the shredded cheese and almond flour/meal in a
microwaveable bowl. Add the cream cheese. Microwave on
HIGH for 1 minute.Stir then microwave on HIGH for another
30 seconds.
2. Add the egg, salt, rosemary and any other flavourings,
mix gently.
3. Place in between 2 pieces of baking parchment/paper
and roll into a circular pizza shape. Remove the top baking
paper/parchment. If the mixture hardens and becomes
difficult to work with, pop it back in the microwave for 10-20
seconds to soften again but not too long or you will cook
the egg.
4. Make fork holes all over the pizza base to ensure it cooks
evenly.
5. Slide the baking paper/parchment with the pizza base, on
a baking tray or pizza stone, and bake at 220�C/425�F for
12-15 minutes, or until brown.
6. To make the base really crispy and sturdy, flip the pizza
over (onto baking paper/parchment) once the top has
browned.
7. Once cooked, remove from the oven and add all the
toppings you like. Make sure any meat is already cooked as
this time it goes back into the oven just to heat up the
toppings and melt the cheese. Bake again at 220�C/425�F
for 5 minutes.
8. Topping Ideas: pepperoni, peppers, cherry tomatoes,
olives, ground/mince beef, mushrooms, herbs to customize
your pizza.

meals.instruction:
Put the coconut oil and nut butter in a small pot over
medium heat. Allow them to melt together, stirring
occasionally.
Add in the cocoa, salt and sweetener and stir.
Pour the mixture into a mini cupcake pan. It's
easiest to line the pan with mini cupcake liners, but
if you don't have them it's ok. You could also use a
large cupcake pan and make the fat bombs a little
bigger as well.
Place in the freezer for about 20 minutes, or until
the mixture is solid in the pan. Remove and eat!
They will melt quickly so you'll want to eat them
fast.

meals.instruction:
1. Leave zucchini skin on and shred zucchini, then add to a
kitchen towel and squeeze out any excess water

2. Toss minced chicken with zucchini, green onion, cilantro,
garlic, salt, and pepper and cumin. Mixture will be quite
wet.
3. Heat oil in a medium pan over medium heat.

4. Use a small scoop or a heaped tablespoon to scoop
meatballs into the pan.

5. Cook 8-10 at a time for about 5-6 minutes on the first
side. Flip and cook an additional 4-5 minutes, or until
golden brown and the centers are cooked through.

Zucchini (leave peel on and squeeze
grated zucchini in a kitchen towel to
remove excess moisture)

Green onion, scallion, ramp (sliced or

meals.instruction:
Heat the vegetable oil in a large pan over medium
heat.
Add the onions and a dash of salt. Cook while
stirring frequently, until the onions are soft and
translucent.
Add the ground beef into the pan. Use a spatula to
break it into pieces. Cook, stirring frequently, until
the ground beef is cooked and no longer pink.
Mix in the curry powder, another dash of salt, and
the black pepper.
Add the cabbage and peas. Cover the pan and allow
it to cook for 2-5 minutes until the cabbage softens.
Add in the lime juice. Top with cilantro and green
onions.

Ground Beef Stir-Fry With
Curried Cabbage

meals.instruction:
1. Season the salmon with salt and pepper. Fill saucepan
with thin layer of water.
2. Place salmon on steamer rack in saucepan.
3. Cook and cover until salmon is opaque (about 10
minutes). Transfer to plate and let cool.
4. Flake salmon into chunks.
5. To make dressing and salad
Mix all ingredients together in a separate bowl using
a whisk, and whisk gently
Assemble mixed greens salad (save some chives
separately) and toss with dressing.
Sprinkle with remaining chives.

ginger, turmeric, garam masala, salt, paprika, and
cayenne pepper. Sautee for 2-3 min until fragrant
and the onions are soft and translucent.
Add garlic and saute for 2 min.
Then add canned tomatoes, tomato paste, and
coconut cream. Mix thoroughly and reduce liquid
until thickened about 10-15 minutes.

almonds and some more cilantro.

meals.instruction:
1. Chop your zucchini and then add it to a large food
processor along with your tahini, lemon juice, olive oil,
garlic, cumin, salt and pepper.
2. Process your zucchini hummus for about 30 seconds - 1
minute, until you get desired consistency. Season to taste
by adding more salt, if needed.
3. Prep your collard wraps by placing them flat (rough side
up) on a cutting board and gently glide a sharp paring knife
across the length of the stem, shaving it down to the same
thickness as the rest of the leaf. Each wrap will require two
leaves for rolling.
4. Place two leaves head to foot, overlapping halfway. Apply
a good amount of hummus at the center where the two
leaves overlap. Add desired toppings (see notes). Fold in
sides and tightly roll like you would a burrito. Cut through
the centre just before eating. Enjoy!

meals.instruction:
1. In a small bowl, whisk together eggs, nutritional yeast,
almond milk, cayenne pepper, and salt. Stir in scallion.
2. Heat a skillet over medium heat and add coconut oil. Add
egg mixture and wait for skillet to return to medium heat.
When a thin cooked layer of egg is apparent at the bottom,
gently move the egg mixture around. Continue to gently
move the egg as it is cooked, exposing more raw egg to the
heat of the pan. This will create large fluffy pillow of egg
rather than small crumbly bits.
3. Serve with avocado. Garnish with sea salt and pepper.
Serve immediately.

4. Cook turkey bacon by placing strips on a skillet and turn

5. Combine salad ingredients in a large bowl.
6. separate 1 large egg yolk in a separate large bowl, whisk
7. Blend egg yolk, mustard, salt, lemon juice, pepper in a
food processor or blender until smooth. Slowly add oil until
emulsified.
8. Add all salad ingredients together, drizzle with dressing.
Serve and enjoy!

meals.instruction:
1. Mix the shredded cheese and almond flour/meal in a
microwaveable bowl. Add the cream cheese. Microwave on
HIGH for 1 minute.Stir then microwave on HIGH for another
30 seconds.
2. Add the egg, salt, rosemary and any other flavourings,
mix gently.
3. Place in between 2 pieces of baking parchment/paper
and roll into a circular pizza shape. Remove the top baking
paper/parchment. If the mixture hardens and becomes
difficult to work with, pop it back in the microwave for 10-20
seconds to soften again but not too long or you will cook
the egg.
4. Make fork holes all over the pizza base to ensure it cooks
evenly.
5. Slide the baking paper/parchment with the pizza base, on
a baking tray or pizza stone, and bake at 220�C/425�F for
12-15 minutes, or until brown.
6. To make the base really crispy and sturdy, flip the pizza
over (onto baking paper/parchment) once the top has
browned.
7. Once cooked, remove from the oven and add all the
toppings you like. Make sure any meat is already cooked as
this time it goes back into the oven just to heat up the
toppings and melt the cheese. Bake again at 220�C/425�F
for 5 minutes.
8. Topping Ideas: pepperoni, peppers, cherry tomatoes,
olives, ground/mince beef, mushrooms, herbs to customize
your pizza.

meals.instruction:
Pour the chicken stock (or vegetable stock) in a large pot
and heat over a medium heat, until it starts to simmer.
Place the turmeric, ginger, garlic, mushrooms, chard stalks
and coconut aminos into the pot and simmer for about 5
minutes.
Then add the sliced chard leaves and cook for another
minute. In a bowl, whisk the eggs and slowly pour them into
the simmering soup.
Keep stirring until the egg is cooked and take off the heat.
Chop the cilantro and slice the spring onions. Add them to
the pot.
Pour into a serving bowl and drizzle with extra virgin olive
oil (a tablespoon per serving). Eat immediately or...
Let it cool down and store in an airtight container for up to
5 days
or...
Let it cool down in glass wide mouth mason jars and put it
in the freezer for another day. Make sure you do NOT fill the
jar higher than recommended, there is a line, or the glass
could break in the freezer.

meals.instruction:
First, lightly steam your finely chopped cauliflower in
a steamer for five minutes. Let the cauliflower cool
while you prep the other ingredients.
Combine the radicchio, artichoke hearts, basil,
parmesan, sundried tomatoes, olives, and garlic in a
medium bowl.
In a smaller bowl, whisk together the olive oil and
vinegar, then pour it over the salad. Toss to
combine, and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Can be served room temperature or chilled.
If you cannot find artichoke hearts you can use raw
asparagus instead chopped into small bits. Both raw
artichoke hearts and raw asparagus are a great source of
resistant starch which is fabulous food for your gut bugs
and essentially indigestible by us - hence it cannot and does
not get converted to sugar.

meals.instruction:
1. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, whey protein, chia
seeds, hemp seeds and flax. Stir until combined.
2. In the same bowl, add in the almond butter, honey,
applesauce, coconut oil and vanilla. Mix until combined.
3. Mixture will be on the wet side. Pour mixture in a 8x8 pan
and allow to set in the fridge until completely cooled.
Mixture will harden up once it gets cold.
4. Remove from fridge, cut into 16 squares. Can be stored in
the fridge for just over a week, or place in the freezer and
they will last for a few months at least. They taste great
directly from the freezer.

heat.
Add the onions and a dash of salt. Cook while
stirring frequently, until the onions are soft and
translucent.
Add the ground beef into the pan. Use a spatula to
break it into pieces. Cook, stirring frequently, until
the ground beef is cooked and no longer pink.
Mix in the curry powder, another dash of salt, and
the black pepper.
Add the cabbage and peas. Cover the pan and allow
it to cook for 2-5 minutes until the cabbage softens.
Add in the lime juice. Top with cilantro and green
onions.

parchment paper or foil.
2. Cook the onions in the vegetable oil in a pan over
medium heat for about 5 minutes until softened. Turn off
the heat, remove the pan from the heat, and allow the
onions to cool.
3. In a large bowl, mix the ground beef, cooked onions,
rosemary, sage, coriander, salt, and black pepper together
until thoroughly combined.
4. Form 2 inch balls from the mixture with your hands.
Arrange the balls on the baking sheet spaced evenly apart.
5. Bake for about 20 minutes in the oven or until the
meatballs are thoroughly cooked.

meals.instruction:
DIRECTIONS FOR MUESLI MIX:
In a medium bowl or a container with a tightly fitting lid,
add coconut flakes, macadamia nuts, chia seeds, pumpkin
seeds, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg and a pinch of salt, mix
well.
Store muesli ingredients in a container with a tightly fitting
lid for a day or two to let the flavors develop. This mixture
will keep for up to two months.
DIRECTIONS FOR EACH SERVING:
In a small bowl, combine coconut milk, alcohol free vanilla,
stevia and lemon juice.
Stir well, then add muesli and top with a dollop of plain
yogurt.
For a softer texture, prepare a bowl the night before. Put a
serving of muesli in a bowl and cover with the coconut milk
mixture.
Place in refrigerator overnight. In the morning, enjoy plain
or with a dollop of yogurt.

1. In a small bowl, whisk together eggs, nutritional yeast,
almond milk, cayenne pepper, and salt. Stir in scallion.
2. Heat a skillet over medium heat and add coconut oil. Add
egg mixture and wait for skillet to return to medium heat.
When a thin cooked layer of egg is apparent at the bottom,
gently move the egg mixture around. Continue to gently
move the egg as it is cooked, exposing more raw egg to the
heat of the pan. This will create large fluffy pillow of egg
rather than small crumbly bits.
3. Serve with avocado. Garnish with sea salt and pepper.
Serve immediately.

meals.instruction:
1. Preheat broiler.

2. Heat olive oil in large ovenproof nonstick skillet over
medium heat. Cook scallions 1 minute, stirring, or until
softened.
3. Transfer scallions to large bowl and set aside. Add
spinach, whole eggs, and egg whites to the bowl with the
scallions. Beat with fork until well blended.
4. Heat remaining oil in skillet over medium heat. Pour in
egg mixture and scatter tomatoes on top. Cover skillet and
cook 4 minutes, or until eggs are set around edges.
5. Broil 5" from heat 4 minutes, or until frittata is lightly
browned and the center is set. Top with cheese, cover, and
let stand 1 minute to melt cheese. Cut into 4 wedges and
serve each with 1 slice toast.
meals.name: 15-Minute Spinach Tomato Frittata

meals.instruction:
1. Wash and dry spinach then chop into pieces
2. Add eggs to a pot and cover with cold water by 1 inch.
Bring water and eggs to a rolling boil at medium/high heat
for about 8-10 minutes. Remove eggs from heat, drain and
cool in ice water and peel
3. Crumble cheese with hands, cut cherry tomatoes in half
or leave full if they are bite size
4. Cook turkey bacon by placing strips on a skillet and turn
every 2-3 minutes, adjusting heat if necessary for about
8-10 minutes until bacon reaches your desired crisp.
Transfer strips using tongs to a paper-towel lined plate to
absorb some of the excess oil. Cut bacon into bite size
pieces for salad
5. Combine salad ingredients in a large bowl.
6. separate 1 large egg yolk in a separate large bowl, whisk
7. Blend egg yolk, mustard, salt, lemon juice, pepper in a
food processor or blender until smooth. Slowly add oil until
emulsified.
8. Add all salad ingredients together, drizzle with dressing.
Serve and enjoy!
meals.name: Clean Eating Cobb Salad

meals.instruction:
1. Shred the brussels sprouts thinly using a mandoline, or a
knife.
2. To prepare the dressing: whisk together the olive oil,
lemon juice, thyme, chives, salt and hazelnuts.
3. Five minutes before serving, place the shredded sprouts
in a large mixing bowl and toss gently with the dressing.
4. Taste and adjust the seasoning, adding more lemon juice
if needed. Keep in mind the cheese will bring a salty
element to the salad.

5. Add the cheese and toss once or twice to distribute it
evenly throughout the salad.
meals.name:
Brussels Sprout Salad with

Hazelnuts

meals.instruction:
1. Cook quinoa according to package directions.
2. Meanwhile, slice strawberries and cherries and place in a
large bowl along with blueberries
3. Mix the dressing ingredients (maple syrup, balsamic, lime
juice, salt) in a small jar and adjust to taste if necessary.
Note: You may have to double the dressing recipe if your
salad is quite large.
4. Fluff cooked quinoa with a fork and add to large bowl
with fruit. Combine. Pour on dressing and mix well.

5. Serve immediately or chill in the fridge until serving time.
meals.name: High Protein Fruit Salad

ingredients.name:
Maple syrup, pure (or other liquid

sweetener)

meals.instruction: Enjoy as a snack in between meals.
meals.name: Toasted Almonds

meals.instruction:
Heat 1 tablespoon of ghee in a cast-iron skillet over
medium heat, and saut� the mushrooms until the
liquid they released has cooked off. Set aside the
cooked mushrooms to cool to room temperature.
Pulse the frozen bacon pieces in the food processor
to the consistency of ground meat. Just a few pushes
should do it!
In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, bacon,
and mushrooms, and season with salt and pepper.
Using your hands, gently combine the ingredients.
Be careful not to overwork the meat!
Divide the mixture into four portions (or more if
you�re making sliders), and use your hands to flatten
each into 3/4-inch-thick patties.
Melt the remaining tablespoon of ghee in a cast iron
skillet over medium heat, and fry up the patties in
the hot fat, turning once. They should take about 3
minutes per side, whereas sliders should only take
about 2 minutes per side. Of course, you are free to
cook �em as well-done as you wish.
Transfer the patties to a wire rack so that any excess
fat can drain off. Pile them with your favorite burger
toppings, wrap them in lettuce leaves or roasted
Portobello mushrooms, and chow down!
meals.name: Big-O Bacon Burgers

ingredients.name: Ghee (lard, or fat of choice, divided)

Bacon (frozen and cross-cut into small

pieces)

meals.instruction:
1. Preheat oven to 450F degrees. Line a baking dish with
parchment paper.

2. Spray or brush both sides of each chicken breast with
olive oil, and sprinkle with salt, pepper, garlic powder, onion
powder, oregano and paprika.

3. Bake, uncovered, for 10 minutes, flip to the other side,
lightly spray/brush again and bake for 8-10 more minutes,
or until juices run clear when pierced with a fork.

4. Transfer the baked chicken breasts to a platter. Loosely
cover with foil and allow to rest 5 minutes before slicing and
serving. Enjoy!
meals.name:
Garlic Herb Baked Chicken

Breast

with thin layer of water.

3. Cook and cover until salmon is opaque (about 10
minutes). Transfer to plate and let cool.
4. Flake salmon into chunks.
5. To make dressing and salad
Mix all ingredients together in a separate bowl using

Assemble mixed greens salad (save some chives
separately) and toss with dressing.

Add Ghee to a pan on medium heat and saut� the
shredded cauliflower.
Add the spinach leaves and cauliflower rice as the
base of the bowl.
Begin to arrange the chopped veggies and poached
eggs on top. (See notes on how to poach an egg)
Cook bacon in a pan on medium-high heat to desired
crispiness, remove from pan and place in a plate
with kitchen paper to soak up some of the fat, then
cut into bite size pieces and sprinkle on top of
veggies and eggs.
Serve and enjoy!
Garnish options: fresh herbs, chopped chili, fresh
lemon, salt and pepper to sprinkle on top, a drizzle

Bulletproof Veggie Buddha
Bowl

meals.instruction:
1. In the bowl of a food processor, add walnut pieces, garlic,
red pepper flakes and salt and process until mixture is
coarsely ground, set aside.
2. Heat chicken broth in a medium saucepan over medium
heat. Add walnut mixture, saffron, paprika, ground
coriander, ground fenugreek and bring to a simmer.
3. Reduce heat to medium low and continue to simmer
sauce for 5 minutes. Remove from heat, stir in raw apple
cider vinegar.
4. Serve sauce at room temperature over grilled chicken.
Refrigerate remaining sauce in a covered container.
meals.name:
Walnut Sauce Over Grilled
Chicken

meals.instruction: Mix everything up and enjoy as an easy and tasty side.

meals.instruction:
DIRECTIONS FOR MUESLI MIX:
In a medium bowl or a container with a tightly fitting lid,
add coconut flakes, macadamia nuts, chia seeds, pumpkin
seeds, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg and a pinch of salt, mix
well.
Store muesli ingredients in a container with a tightly fitting
lid for a day or two to let the flavors develop. This mixture
will keep for up to two months.
DIRECTIONS FOR EACH SERVING:
In a small bowl, combine coconut milk, alcohol free vanilla,
stevia and lemon juice.
Stir well, then add muesli and top with a dollop of plain
yogurt.
For a softer texture, prepare a bowl the night before. Put a
serving of muesli in a bowl and cover with the coconut milk
mixture.
Place in refrigerator overnight. In the morning, enjoy plain
or with a dollop of yogurt.
meals.name: Bircher Muesli

ingredients.name:
Macadamia nuts, unsalted (you can use
hazelnuts, almonds, pecans or walnuts)

meals.instruction:
1. Process the parsley, mint, garlic and sea salt in a food
processor until minced.

2. Transfer the herbs and salt to a large mixing bowl.

3. Add the tomatoes, hemp seeds, olive oil and lemon juice.
Mix well and serve.

meals.instruction:
Heat the vegetable oil in a large pan over medium
heat.
Add the onions and a dash of salt. Cook while
stirring frequently, until the onions are soft and
translucent.
Add the ground beef into the pan. Use a spatula to
break it into pieces. Cook, stirring frequently, until
the ground beef is cooked and no longer pink.
Mix in the curry powder, another dash of salt, and
the black pepper.
Add the cabbage and peas. Cover the pan and allow
it to cook for 2-5 minutes until the cabbage softens.
Add in the lime juice. Top with cilantro and green
onions.

Curried Cabbage

pieces)

meals.instruction:
1. Preheat broiler.

2. Heat olive oil in large ovenproof nonstick skillet over
medium heat. Cook scallions 1 minute, stirring, or until
softened.
3. Transfer scallions to large bowl and set aside. Add
spinach, whole eggs, and egg whites to the bowl with the
scallions. Beat with fork until well blended.
4. Heat remaining oil in skillet over medium heat. Pour in
egg mixture and scatter tomatoes on top. Cover skillet and
cook 4 minutes, or until eggs are set around edges.
5. Broil 5" from heat 4 minutes, or until frittata is lightly
browned and the center is set. Top with cheese, cover, and
let stand 1 minute to melt cheese. Cut into 4 wedges and
serve each with 1 slice toast.
meals.name: 15-Minute Spinach Tomato Frittata

meals.instruction:
Pancakes
1. In a small bowl, sift coconut flour, baking soda and salt,
set aside.
2. In a medium bowl, whisk the eggs, and add milk, sliced
green onions and mashed avocado until thoroughly
combined.
3. Add dry ingredients and stir until combined.
4. Heat a skillet over medium heat. Melt enough coconut oil
to coat the bottom of pan.
5. For each pancake, spoon about 1/4 cup batter into pan
and cook until bubbles begin to appear on the top and
bottom is golden brown, about 2 to 3 minutes.
6. Flip pancake and cook until second side is golden brown,
about 2 to 3 minutes. Continue with remaining batter,
adding more butter to skillet as needed.
Lemon Parsley Sauce.
1. Melt the coconut oil and stir in lemon juice and parsley.
Keep warm until ready to serve.
Serve pancakes with sliced avocado, spring greens, lemon
slices and a drizzle of Lemon Coconut Parsley Sauce.
Garnish with thinly sliced green onions and minced parsley.
meals.name:
Avocado Pancakes with
Lemon Coconut Parsley
Sauce

meals.instruction:
Line a 9x9-inch or 7x11-in pan with parchment or
wax paper.
In a medium microwave-safe bowl, heat the peanut
butter and honey on high for 30 seconds. Stir. Place
bowl back in the microwave and heat for another 30
seconds. Stir again. Mix in the oats and protein
powder until combined. Immediately spread evenly
into the prepared pan.
Refrigerate, uncovered, for 1 hour. Remove from the
fridge and cut into 12 bars. Cover and store on the
counter at room temperature for up to 1 week. (I just
store mine in the same pan with a lid.)
meals.name:
Easy Peanut Butter Protein
Bars

ingredients.name:
Whey protein powder, isolate, vanilla
(or any other protein powder)

meals.instruction:
Pour the chicken stock (or vegetable stock) in a large pot
and heat over a medium heat, until it starts to simmer.
Place the turmeric, ginger, garlic, mushrooms, chard stalks
and coconut aminos into the pot and simmer for about 5
minutes.
Then add the sliced chard leaves and cook for another
minute. In a bowl, whisk the eggs and slowly pour them into
the simmering soup.
Keep stirring until the egg is cooked and take off the heat.
Chop the cilantro and slice the spring onions. Add them to
the pot.
Pour into a serving bowl and drizzle with extra virgin olive
oil (a tablespoon per serving). Eat immediately or...
Let it cool down and store in an airtight container for up to
5 days
or...
Let it cool down in glass wide mouth mason jars and put it
in the freezer for another day. Make sure you do NOT fill the
jar higher than recommended, there is a line, or the glass
could break in the freezer.

meals.instruction:
1. Crack the eggs into a mixing bowl, season with a pinch of
sea salt and black pepper, then beat well with a fork until
fully combined.
2. Place a small non-stick frying pan on a low heat to warm
up.
3. Grate the cheese onto a board and set aside.
4. Add 1/2 tablespoon of oil to the hot pan, then carefully
pour in the eggs.
5. Tilt the pan to spread them out evenly, using a fork to
swirl the eggs around the pan a little.
6. When the omelette begins to cook and firm up, but still
has a little raw egg on top, sprinkle over the cheese.
7. Using a spatula, ease around the edges of the omelette,
then fold it over in half.
8. When it starts to turn golden brown underneath, remove
the pan from the heat and slide the omelette onto a plate. .
Enjoy!
meals.name: Simple Cheese Omelette

meals.instruction:
1. Preheat oven to 400F. Line a baking sheet with
parchment paper or foil.
2. Cook the onions in the vegetable oil in a pan over
medium heat for about 5 minutes until softened. Turn off
the heat, remove the pan from the heat, and allow the
onions to cool.
3. In a large bowl, mix the ground beef, cooked onions,
rosemary, sage, coriander, salt, and black pepper together
until thoroughly combined.
4. Form 2 inch balls from the mixture with your hands.
Arrange the balls on the baking sheet spaced evenly apart.
5. Bake for about 20 minutes in the oven or until the
meatballs are thoroughly cooked.

Add garlic and saute for 2 min.

seeds, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg and a pinch of salt, mix
well.
Store muesli ingredients in a container with a tightly fitting
lid for a day or two to let the flavors develop. This mixture
will keep for up to two months.
DIRECTIONS FOR EACH SERVING:
In a small bowl, combine coconut milk, alcohol free vanilla,
stevia and lemon juice.
Stir well, then add muesli and top with a dollop of plain
yogurt.
For a softer texture, prepare a bowl the night before. Put a
serving of muesli in a bowl and cover with the coconut milk
mixture.
Place in refrigerator overnight. In the morning, enjoy plain
or with a dollop of yogurt.
meals.name: Bircher Muesli

ingredients.name:
Macadamia nuts, unsalted (you can use
hazelnuts, almonds, pecans or walnuts)

meals.instruction:
Line a 9x9-inch or 7x11-in pan with parchment or
wax paper.
In a medium microwave-safe bowl, heat the peanut
butter and honey on high for 30 seconds. Stir. Place
bowl back in the microwave and heat for another 30
seconds. Stir again. Mix in the oats and protein
powder until combined. Immediately spread evenly
into the prepared pan.
Refrigerate, uncovered, for 1 hour. Remove from the
fridge and cut into 12 bars. Cover and store on the
counter at room temperature for up to 1 week. (I just
store mine in the same pan with a lid.)
meals.name:
Easy Peanut Butter Protein
Bars

ingredients.name:
Whey protein powder, isolate, vanilla
(or any other protein powder)

meals.instruction:
1. In a small bowl, whisk together eggs, nutritional yeast,
almond milk, cayenne pepper, and salt. Stir in scallion.
2. Heat a skillet over medium heat and add coconut oil. Add
egg mixture and wait for skillet to return to medium heat.
When a thin cooked layer of egg is apparent at the bottom,
gently move the egg mixture around. Continue to gently
move the egg as it is cooked, exposing more raw egg to the
heat of the pan. This will create large fluffy pillow of egg
rather than small crumbly bits.
3. Serve with avocado. Garnish with sea salt and pepper.
Serve immediately.
meals.name: Easy-Peasy Scrambled Eggs and Veggies

meals.instruction: Enjoy as a snack in between meals.
meals.name: Toasted Almonds

meals.instruction:
Mix all ingredients together in a bowl.
Enjoy!
meals.name: SEED CEREAL

meals.instruction:
1. Preheat oven to 400F. Line a baking sheet with
parchment paper or foil.
2. Cook the onions in the vegetable oil in a pan over
medium heat for about 5 minutes until softened. Turn off
the heat, remove the pan from the heat, and allow the
onions to cool.
3. In a large bowl, mix the ground beef, cooked onions,
rosemary, sage, coriander, salt, and black pepper together
until thoroughly combined.
4. Form 2 inch balls from the mixture with your hands.
Arrange the balls on the baking sheet spaced evenly apart.
5. Bake for about 20 minutes in the oven or until the
meatballs are thoroughly cooked.
meals.name: Easy Baked Meatballs

meals.instruction:
1. Add baby spinach to a large mixing bowl.

2. Add pesto, 1/2 tablespoon olive oil, salt and pepper to
your mixing bowl with the spinach, mix to combine all of the
ingredients and coat the spinach. Top with goat cheese or
1/2 an avocado and set aside.

3. Prepare the eggs whatever way you like them best
(poached, scrambled, over easy, over hard). I like them
poached, see notes for poached instructions.
4. Place the prepared eggs on top of spinach mixture. Dig
in!
meals.name: My Go-to Eggs & Greens

ingredients.name:
Baby spinach (can use any type of

greens)

Basil pesto (Sunflower Kitchen makes

amazing pestos!)

Goat cheese, semi-soft (can use 1/2 an
avocado for dairy free version)

meals.instruction:
Pancakes
1. In a small bowl, sift coconut flour, baking soda and salt,
set aside.
2. In a medium bowl, whisk the eggs, and add milk, sliced
green onions and mashed avocado until thoroughly
combined.
3. Add dry ingredients and stir until combined.
4. Heat a skillet over medium heat. Melt enough coconut oil
to coat the bottom of pan.
5. For each pancake, spoon about 1/4 cup batter into pan
and cook until bubbles begin to appear on the top and
bottom is golden brown, about 2 to 3 minutes.
6. Flip pancake and cook until second side is golden brown,
about 2 to 3 minutes. Continue with remaining batter,
adding more butter to skillet as needed.
Lemon Parsley Sauce.
1. Melt the coconut oil and stir in lemon juice and parsley.
Keep warm until ready to serve.
Serve pancakes with sliced avocado, spring greens, lemon
slices and a drizzle of Lemon Coconut Parsley Sauce.
Garnish with thinly sliced green onions and minced parsley.
meals.name:
Avocado Pancakes with
Lemon Coconut Parsley
Sauce

meals.instruction:
1. Preheat oven to 450F degrees. Line a baking dish with
parchment paper.

2. Spray or brush both sides of each chicken breast with
olive oil, and sprinkle with salt, pepper, garlic powder, onion
powder, oregano and paprika.

3. Bake, uncovered, for 10 minutes, flip to the other side,
lightly spray/brush again and bake for 8-10 more minutes,
or until juices run clear when pierced with a fork.

4. Transfer the baked chicken breasts to a platter. Loosely
cover with foil and allow to rest 5 minutes before slicing and
serving. Enjoy!
meals.name:
Garlic Herb Baked Chicken

Breast

meals.instruction:
1. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, whey protein, chia
seeds, hemp seeds and flax. Stir until combined.
2. In the same bowl, add in the almond butter, honey,
applesauce, coconut oil and vanilla. Mix until combined.
3. Mixture will be on the wet side. Pour mixture in a 8x8 pan
and allow to set in the fridge until completely cooled.
Mixture will harden up once it gets cold.
4. Remove from fridge, cut into 16 squares. Can be stored in
the fridge for just over a week, or place in the freezer and
they will last for a few months at least. They taste great
directly from the freezer.
meals.name:
No-Bake Hemp and Chia

Protein Bars

ingredients.name:
Almond butter (or peanut butter or

sunflower seed butter)

meals.instruction:
1. In the bowl of a food processor, add walnut pieces, garlic,
red pepper flakes and salt and process until mixture is
coarsely ground, set aside.
2. Heat chicken broth in a medium saucepan over medium
heat. Add walnut mixture, saffron, paprika, ground
coriander, ground fenugreek and bring to a simmer.
3. Reduce heat to medium low and continue to simmer
sauce for 5 minutes. Remove from heat, stir in raw apple
cider vinegar.
4. Serve sauce at room temperature over grilled chicken.
Refrigerate remaining sauce in a covered container.
meals.name:
Walnut Sauce Over Grilled
Chicken

meals.instruction:
Optional:
Steam the tempeh.
The easiest way to do this is by wrapping it in a wet
paper towel and placing in a microwave safe bowl.
Microwave in 2 minute increments, for 4 to 6
minutes total, stopping and letting it sit for a minute
or so between increments.
1. Stir coconut aminos, garlic, and ginger together in a
small bowl.
2. Coat the bottom of a large skillet with 1 tablespoon of
avocado oil and place over medium heat.
3. Add tempeh cubes in a single layer. Cook about 10
minutes, flipping once or twice, until browned on multiple
sides. Remove from heat.
4. Sprinkle the stir-fried tempeh with sesame seeds.
Serve and enjoy!
meals.name: Tempeh Stir-Fry ( Keto )

meals.name: Easy Baked Meatballs

meals.instruction:
1. Mix the shredded cheese and almond flour/meal in a
microwaveable bowl. Add the cream cheese. Microwave on
HIGH for 1 minute.Stir then microwave on HIGH for another
30 seconds.
2. Add the egg, salt, rosemary and any other flavourings,
mix gently.
3. Place in between 2 pieces of baking parchment/paper
and roll into a circular pizza shape. Remove the top baking
paper/parchment. If the mixture hardens and becomes
difficult to work with, pop it back in the microwave for 10-20
seconds to soften again but not too long or you will cook
the egg.
4. Make fork holes all over the pizza base to ensure it cooks
evenly.
5. Slide the baking paper/parchment with the pizza base, on
a baking tray or pizza stone, and bake at 220�C/425�F for
12-15 minutes, or until brown.
6. To make the base really crispy and sturdy, flip the pizza
over (onto baking paper/parchment) once the top has
browned.
7. Once cooked, remove from the oven and add all the
toppings you like. Make sure any meat is already cooked as
this time it goes back into the oven just to heat up the
toppings and melt the cheese. Bake again at 220�C/425�F
for 5 minutes.
8. Topping Ideas: pepperoni, peppers, cherry tomatoes,
olives, ground/mince beef, mushrooms, herbs to customize
your pizza.
meals.name: Fat Head Pizza

Sauce

meals.instruction:
Put the coconut oil and nut butter in a small pot over
medium heat. Allow them to melt together, stirring
occasionally.
Add in the cocoa, salt and sweetener and stir.
Pour the mixture into a mini cupcake pan. It's
easiest to line the pan with mini cupcake liners, but
if you don't have them it's ok. You could also use a
large cupcake pan and make the fat bombs a little
bigger as well.
Place in the freezer for about 20 minutes, or until
the mixture is solid in the pan. Remove and eat!
They will melt quickly so you'll want to eat them
fast.
meals.name:
Vegan Salted Chocolate
Freeze Fudge 2 ways!

ingredients.name:
Almond butter (can sub peanut butter

or nut butter of choice)

Maple syrup, pure (can sub preffered

sweetener (liquid))

meals.instruction:
1. Process the parsley, mint, garlic and sea salt in a food
processor until minced.

2. Transfer the herbs and salt to a large mixing bowl.

3. Add the tomatoes, hemp seeds, olive oil and lemon juice.
Mix well and serve.
meals.name: Hemp Seed Tabouli

meals.instruction:
Toss noodles and vegetables in peanut sauce.
Sprinkle with sesame seeds, cilantro, chopped peanuts, and a wedge of lime.
Can be served hot or cold - enjoy!
Advanced Preparation
1 - 3 days prior [optional], Japanese noodles, soba, dry 29 gm
Instructions:
Cook noodles according to package instructions. Store in an airtight container in the fridge.
1 - 5 days prior [optional], Peanut butter, natural 1/2 cup
Instructions:
Combine all peanut sauce ingredients in a blender. Blend until smooth. Season with salt and pepper.
meals.name:
Soba Noodle Salad with
Spicy Peanut Sauce (keto)

ingredients.name:
Green onion, scallion, ramp (thinly
sliced on a diagonal, garnish)

Cayenne pepper (to taste, for peanut

sauce)

Stevia, liquid (to taste, for peanut

sauce)

meals.instruction:
Add Ghee to a pan on medium heat and saut� the
shredded cauliflower.
Add the spinach leaves and cauliflower rice as the
base of the bowl.
Begin to arrange the chopped veggies and poached
eggs on top. (See notes on how to poach an egg)
Cook bacon in a pan on medium-high heat to desired
crispiness, remove from pan and place in a plate
with kitchen paper to soak up some of the fat, then
cut into bite size pieces and sprinkle on top of
veggies and eggs.
Serve and enjoy!
Garnish options: fresh herbs, chopped chili, fresh
lemon, salt and pepper to sprinkle on top, a drizzle
of Brain Octane Oil on top.
meals.name:
Bulletproof Veggie Buddha
Bowl

meals.instruction:
First, lightly steam your finely chopped cauliflower in
a steamer for five minutes. Let the cauliflower cool
while you prep the other ingredients.
Combine the radicchio, artichoke hearts, basil,
parmesan, sundried tomatoes, olives, and garlic in a
medium bowl.
In a smaller bowl, whisk together the olive oil and
vinegar, then pour it over the salad. Toss to
combine, and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Can be served room temperature or chilled.
If you cannot find artichoke hearts you can use raw
asparagus instead chopped into small bits. Both raw
artichoke hearts and raw asparagus are a great source of
resistant starch which is fabulous food for your gut bugs
and essentially indigestible by us - hence it cannot and does
not get converted to sugar.
meals.name:
Antipasto Cauliflower
Salad ( Keto )

meals.instruction:
1. Wash and cut celery into 2 or 3-inch pieces.
2. Season cottage cheese with salt and pepper to taste.
3. If you like, add some dried or fresh herbs, like basil, dill,
rosemary, thyme, or oregano.
4. Fill indention in celery with cottage cheese. Slice some of
the cherry tomatoes in half, and place them on top of
cottage cheese-filled celery. Enjoy!
meals.name:
Cottage Cheese and
Veggie Snack

ingredients.name:
Cottage cheese (2% M.F.) (Grass-fed
with live probiotic cultures)

meals.instruction:
1. Wash and dry spinach then chop into pieces
2. Add eggs to a pot and cover with cold water by 1 inch.
Bring water and eggs to a rolling boil at medium/high heat
for about 8-10 minutes. Remove eggs from heat, drain and
cool in ice water and peel
3. Crumble cheese with hands, cut cherry tomatoes in half
or leave full if they are bite size
4. Cook turkey bacon by placing strips on a skillet and turn
every 2-3 minutes, adjusting heat if necessary for about
8-10 minutes until bacon reaches your desired crisp.
Transfer strips using tongs to a paper-towel lined plate to
absorb some of the excess oil. Cut bacon into bite size
pieces for salad
5. Combine salad ingredients in a large bowl.
6. separate 1 large egg yolk in a separate large bowl, whisk
7. Blend egg yolk, mustard, salt, lemon juice, pepper in a
food processor or blender until smooth. Slowly add oil until
emulsified.
8. Add all salad ingredients together, drizzle with dressing.
Serve and enjoy!
meals.name: Clean Eating Cobb Salad

meals.instruction:
Add all ingredients to a high-powered blender and
blitz until evenly combined, smooth and creamy.
Depending on how thick you like your smoothie you
can add in extra water and re-blend it until you
reach your desired consistency.
Taste and adjust the flavors if needed.
Pour into glasses and top with your chosen toppings.
See "Notes' below.
Notes:
Optional toppings
Chopped Bulletproof Chocolate Fuel Bar
Fresh organic raspberries or blueberries
Nut or seed butter
Shredded coconut
1-inch fresh grated ginger root
meals.name:
Keto Green Lemon
Smoothie

meals.instruction:
Pour lemon juice over kale and add a pinch of salt.
Massage into the kale with your hands for a couple
minutes to tenderize.
Top bed of kale with vegetables, avocado, hemp
seeds and olives. Drizzle with herbed dressing.

Advanced Preparation
1 - 5 days prior [optional], Extra virgin olive oil 4 tbsp
Instructions:
Combine all dressing ingredients in a glass jar and
shake well.
meals.name:
Herbal Kale Salad (vegan

keto)

ingredients.name:
Stevia, liquid (more or less to taste, for

dressing)

Hemp seeds, shelled (or slivered
almond, walnuts, or pine nuts)

Nuts, mixed nuts, dry
roasted with peanuts,
salted

ingredients.name:
Nuts, mixed nuts, dry
roasted with peanuts,
salted

meals.instruction:
1. Shred the brussels sprouts thinly using a mandoline, or a
knife.
2. To prepare the dressing: whisk together the olive oil,
lemon juice, thyme, chives, salt and hazelnuts.
3. Five minutes before serving, place the shredded sprouts
in a large mixing bowl and toss gently with the dressing.
4. Taste and adjust the seasoning, adding more lemon juice
if needed. Keep in mind the cheese will bring a salty
element to the salad.

5. Add the cheese and toss once or twice to distribute it
evenly throughout the salad.
meals.name:
Brussels Sprout Salad with

Hazelnuts

meals.instruction:
1. Combine almonds, sunflower seeds, flax meal and berries
in a bowl and pour coconut milk over them.

2. Top with cinnamon and serve in a beautiful bowl that
makes you feel like the awesome being you are!

Beautifying Breakfast
Cereal
